title: Biodiversity data: From data collection to publication
text:
Welcome
This five-day training course, co-organized by the FRB-CESAB, the PNDB, and GBIF France aims to work on the different stages of the data cycle, from acquisition to opening, including management, storage and the drafting of data papers.
We will 1) contextualize the issues surrounding the understanding, sharing and (re)use of biodiversity data and metadata, and 2) enhance the skills of communities involved in one or more stages of the data cycle.

title: Biodiversity data: From data collection to publication
text:
Program
General context

Current challenges in biodiversity data
The data ecosystem
Reproducibility concepts
What is data/metadata?
Major types of biodiversity data
Framework and good practices (data cycle, FAIR, etc.)

Data acquisition

Best practices for data collection
Major biodiversity databases
Data acquisition: Web portals, API & web scraping

Data management

Structure, formats & files
Processing & cleansing data
OpenRefine
Virtual Research Environments

DataSHARE projects

FRB-CESAB DataSHARE call
Zoom on Islets & PhenoFish groups

Legal aspects

Sharing, licensing, etc.

Opening data

Data management plan
(Meta)data: standards
Storage and archiving
Dissemination and sharing
Enhancing value: data paper & software paper

title: Biodiversity data: From data collection to publication
text:
Prerequisites
  Please follow this tutorial to install your working environment before attending the training course. Note that you just need to install R, RStudio IDE (optional) and Rtools (for Windows users).

title: Biodiversity data: From data collection to publication
text:
Material
All the material used in this training course (slides, data, exercises) is available at: https://github.com/biodiversitydata/

title: Biodiversity data: From data collection to publication
text:
Citation

Casajus N, Coux C, Le Bras Y, Norvez O, Archambeau A-S & Pamerlon S (2024) Biodiversity data: From data collection to publication. An FRB-CESAB, PNDB & GBIF France training course. URL: https://biodiversitydata.github.io/

title: Biodiversity data: From data collection to publication
text:
See also
Discover the other training courses provided by the FRB-CESAB and its partners: https://frbcesab.github.io/training-courses/

title: Prerequisites
text:
The guide to correctly install and set up R, RStudio IDE (optional) and Rtools (for Windows users) is available at: https://frbcesab.github.io/rsetup/






Note



For this training course, you do not need to install Quarto, git, nor Docker. But you need to configure RStudio IDE as explaining here.
